text: (upbeat music)

- At Pinterest, we have
an exabyte data platform.

And the main challenge
that we had was that
when we deploy analytics toolings,

the permissions that users
have is of the EC2 instances.

And what we wanted to do
was to enable users to

be able to have the
permissions for their jobs.

So any data that a user
should be able to access

should have the
permissions for their jobs.

We collaborated with AWS,
with their S3 and IAM teams

to create a fine-grain
access control system

that's integrated with
AWS's STS token system

and our LDAP service so that
we can then get the permissions
for the jobs from the user's permissions.
So in the past,

we needed to create a new
cluster for new use cases.

For every time we had new
data that had different

access permissions, we needed
to create a new cluster.

What it means now is that we
can just configure an existing

cluster, and the new use case
can be run straight away.

So it speeds up development
for our internal users.

We can actually run any job
with the permission of a user
so we can do lots of use cases,
new use cases, using existing clusters
and just simply configure those clusters
to be able to handle these new jobs.
